conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame, analyze the forces on each segment due to the magnetic field.
The wire frame consists of a straight segment MN and a semi-circular segment MQN. The magnetic field is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of the wire frame.
The force on the straight segment MN due to the magnetic field is given by F.
The semi-circular wire MQN experiences a force due to the magnetic field, but the resultant force cancels out due to symmetry.
The force on the straight segment MN is F, and the semi-circular segment MQN does not contribute to the net force.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is only due to the straight segment MN.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is F.
